abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Telecommunications Project
            consists of: (a) addition of 65,000 lines capacity to the
            local telephone network for connecting 57,350 direct
            exchange lines; (b) 6 microwave systems, UHF and VHF
            systems, openwire lines and carrier systems for a total of
            1,130 circuits and 500 long-distance public call offices;
            (c) 4 trunk automatic exchanges with a total capacity of
            2,500 circuits; (d) 1 international automatic telephone
            exchange with a capacity of 150 circuits; and (e)
            consultancy services for management and accounting
            improvement and training programs.
